Apple__Apple_scab.name: Apple__Apple_scab
Apple__Apple_scab.description:
1. Apple scab is a fungal disease that affects apple trees and causes damage to leaves, fruit, and twigs.
2. The disease is caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis and is characterized by the appearance of dark, velvety spots on the leaves and fruit.
3. Apple scab can reduce the yield and quality of apple crops, and can also weaken the tree over time if left untreated.

Apple__Black_rot.name: Apple__Black_rot
Apple__Black_rot.description:
1. Fungal disease affecting apple trees in India.
2. Caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa fungus.
3. Results in circular, sunken lesions on fruit, turning black and mummified.

Apple__Cedar_apple_rust.name: Apple__Cedar_apple_rust
Apple__Cedar_apple_rust.description:
1. Fungal disease affecting apple and cedar trees.
2. Orange spots on apple leaves, brown galls on cedar trees.
3. Spores spread by wind, causing damage to apple crops if untreated.

Apple__healthy.name: Apple__healthy
Apple__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Blueberry__healthy.name: Blueberry__healthy
Blueberry__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Cherry_(including_sour)__Powdery_mildew.name: Cherry_(including_sour)__Powdery_mildew
Cherry_(including_sour)__Powdery_mildew.description:
1. Cherry Powdery Mildew is a fungal disease that affects cherry trees, including sour cherries.
2. It appears as a white or gray powdery coating on the leaves, stems, and fruit of the tree.
3. The disease can cause reduced growth, defoliation, and reduced fruit quality, and can be controlled through the use of fungicides and cultural practices such as pruning and sanitation.

Cherry_(including_sour)__healthy.name: Cherry_(including_sour)__healthy
Cherry_(including_sour)__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Corn_(maize)__Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_.name: Corn_(maize)__Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_spot
Corn_(maize)__Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_.description:
1. Corn Cercospora leaf spot is a fungal disease that affects the leaves of maize plants.
2. It is characterized by the appearance of small, circular spots on the leaves that are grayish-brown in color with a reddish-brown border.
3. The disease can cause significant yield losses if left untreated, and management strategies include crop rotation, fungicide applications, and sanitation practices.

Corn_(maize)__Common_rust.name: Corn_(maize)__Common_rust
Corn_(maize)__Common_rust.description:
1. Common rust is a fungal disease that affects maize crops.
2. It appears as small, circular, reddish-brown pustules on the leaves, stems, and husks of the plant.
3. The disease can reduce the yield and quality of the maize crop if left untreated, but can be controlled through the use of fungicides and other management practices.

Corn_(maize)__Northern_Leaf_Blight.name: Corn_(maize)__Northern_Leaf_Blight
Corn_(maize)__Northern_Leaf_Blight.description:
1. Corn Northern Leaf Blight is a fungal disease that affects maize crops in India.
2. It is characterized by the appearance of cigar-shaped lesions on the leaves, which can cause significant yield losses if left untreated.
3. Management strategies for controlling Northern Leaf Blight include crop rotation, use of resistant varieties, and timely application of fungicides.

Corn_(maize)__healthy.name: Corn_(maize)__healthy
Corn_(maize)__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Grape__Black_rot.name: Grape__Black_rot
Grape__Black_rot.description:
1. Black rot is a fungal disease that affects grapevines.
2. It causes black spots on leaves and fruit, leading to yield loss.
3. Proper management practices such as pruning and fungicide application can help control the disease.

Grape__Esca_(Black_Measles).name: Grape__Esca_(Black_Measles)
Grape__Esca_(Black_Measles).description:
1. Grape Esca is a fungal disease that affects grapevines.
2. It causes leaf discoloration, wood decay, and eventual vine death.
3. The disease is difficult to control and can result in significant economic losses for grape growers.

Grape__Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot.name: Grape__Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot)
Grape__Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spot.description:
1. Grape leaf blight is caused by a fungus called Isariopsis.
2. It causes small, circular spots on leaves that turn brown with a yellow halo.
3. The disease can be controlled by removing infected leaves and using fungicides.

Grape__healthy.name: Grape__healthy
Grape__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Orange__Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).name: Orange__Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening)
Orange__Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description:
1. Citrus greening disease caused by bacteria.
2. Affects citrus trees, causing yellowing and decline.
3. No cure, management involves control of insect vectors and removal of infected trees.

Peach__Bacterial_spot.name: Peach__Bacterial_spot
Peach__Bacterial_spot.description:
1. Peach bacterial spot is a serious disease caused by Xanthomonas arboricola.
2. It affects the leaves, fruit, and twigs of peach trees.
3. Symptoms include dark spots on leaves, cankers on twigs, and lesions on fruit.

Peach__healthy.name: Peach__healthy
Peach__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Pepper,_bell__Bacterial_spot.name: Pepper,_bell__Bacterial_spot
Pepper,_bell__Bacterial_spot.description:
1. Bacterial spot is a serious disease affecting pepper crops.
2. Caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria bacteria.
3. Symptoms include dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit, leading to defoliation and yield loss.

Pepper,_bell__healthy.name: Pepper,_bell__healthy
Pepper,_bell__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Potato__Early_blight.name: Potato__Early_blight
Potato__Early_blight.description:
1. Early blight is a fungal disease affecting potato plants.
2. Caused by Alternaria solani fungus.
3. Symptoms include dark brown lesions on leaves, leading to defoliation and reduced yield if untreated.

Potato__Late_blight.name: Potato__Late_blight
Potato__Late_blight.description:
1. Late blight is a fungal disease affecting potato plants.
2. Caused by Phytophthora infestans fungus.
3. Symptoms include water-soaked lesions on leaves, leading to rapid defoliation and tuber rot if untreated.

Potato__healthy.name: Potato__healthy
Potato__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Raspberry__healthy.name: Raspberry__healthy
Raspberry__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Soybean__healthy.name: Soybean__healthy
Soybean__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Squash__Powdery_mildew.name: Squash__Powdery_mildew
Squash__Powdery_mildew.description:
1. Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects squash plants.
2. Caused by Podosphaera xanthii fungus.
3. Symptoms include white powdery spots on leaves, which can lead to reduced photosynthesis and yield loss if untreated.

Strawberry__Leaf_scorch.name: Strawberry__Leaf_scorch
Strawberry__Leaf_scorch.description:
1. Leaf scorch is a fungal disease affecting strawberry plants.
2. Caused by Diplocarpon earlianum fungus.
3. Symptoms include red spots on leaves, which can lead to defoliation and reduced yield if untreated.

Strawberry__healthy.name: Strawberry__healthy
Strawberry__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.

Tomato__Bacterial_spot.name: Tomato__Bacterial_spot
Tomato__Bacterial_spot.description:
1. Bacterial spot is a serious disease affecting tomato crops.
2. Caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria bacteria.
3. Symptoms include dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit, leading to defoliation and yield loss.

Tomato__Early_blight.name: Tomato__Early_blight
Tomato__Early_blight.description:
1. Early blight is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by Alternaria solani fungus.
3. Symptoms include dark brown lesions on leaves, leading to defoliation and reduced yield if untreated.

Tomato__Late_blight.name: Tomato__Late_blight
Tomato__Late_blight.description:
1. Late blight is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by Phytophthora infestans fungus.
3. Symptoms include water-soaked lesions on leaves, leading to rapid defoliation and fruit rot if untreated.

Tomato__Leaf_Mold.name: Tomato__Leaf_Mold
Tomato__Leaf_Mold.description:
1. Leaf mold is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by Cladosporium fulvum fungus.
3. Symptoms include yellowing and browning of leaves, which can lead to reduced yield if untreated.

Tomato__Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Tomato__Septoria_leaf_spot
Tomato__Septoria_leaf_spot.description:
1. Septoria leaf spot is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by Septoria lycopersici fungus.
3. Symptoms include small, dark spots on leaves, which can lead to defoliation and reduced yield if untreated.

Tomato__Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_.name: Tomato__Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_mite
Tomato__Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider_.description:
1. Spider mites are common pests that affect tomato plants.
2. They feed on plant juices, causing yellow stippling on leaves and reducing plant vigor.
3. Management involves using predatory mites, insecticidal soaps, and reducing dust to control populations.

Tomato__Target_Spot.name: Tomato__Target_Spot
Tomato__Target_Spot.description:
1. Target spot is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by Corynespora cassiicola fungus.
3. Symptoms include circular lesions with concentric rings on leaves, which can lead to defoliation and reduced yield if untreated.

Tomato__Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.name: Tomato__Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus
Tomato__Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description:
1. Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus is a viral disease affecting tomato plants.
2. Caused by begomoviruses transmitted by whiteflies.
3. Symptoms include yellowing and curling of leaves, stunted growth, and reduced yield.

Tomato__healthy.name: Tomato__healthy
Tomato__healthy.description: This plant is growing strong and healthy.
